revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-19 10:50:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/mdns.py', 'ironic_lib/tests/test_mdns.py'], 'message': 'Compatibility with zeroconf 0.129.0

From Zeroconf CHANGELOG.md:
v0.129.0 (2023-12-13)

Feature

* Add decoded_properties method to ServiceInfo
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/issues/1332
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/commit/9b595a1dcacf109c699953219d70fe36296c7318
* Ensure ServiceInfo.properties always returns bytes
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/issues/1333
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/commit/d29553ab7de6b7af70769ddb804fe2aaf492f320

Technically breaking change

* `ServiceInfo.properties` always returns a dictionary with type
`dict[bytes, bytes | None]` instead of a mix `str` and `bytes`. It was
only possible to get a mixed dictionary if it was manually passed in
when `ServiceInfo` was constructed.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Change-Id: I7f1a0c3329e5f29ec3e274558e3681142cc2ef78
'}]
commit_message:
Compatibility with zeroconf 0.129.0

From Zeroconf CHANGELOG.md:
v0.129.0 (2023-12-13)

Feature

* Add decoded_properties method to ServiceInfo
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/issues/1332
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/commit/9b595a1dcacf109c699953219d70fe36296c7318
* Ensure ServiceInfo.properties always returns bytes
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/issues/1333
https://github.com/python-zeroconf/python-zeroconf/commit/d29553ab7de6b7af70769ddb804fe2aaf492f320

Technically breaking change

* `ServiceInfo.properties` always returns a dictionary with type
`dict[bytes, bytes | None]` instead of a mix `str` and `bytes`. It was
only possible to get a mixed dictionary if it was manually passed in
when `ServiceInfo` was constructed.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@protonmail.com>
Change-Id: I7f1a0c3329e5f29ec3e274558e3681142cc2ef78

commit_message:
[WIP] Fix hacluster stuck "resource not yet configured"

Moved ha_relation_changed code to utils
to be invoked when the charm is stuck
pending an action on pacemaker to be
executed, which would only be
triggered on a ha-relation-changed
hook.

Now config_changed can end up invoking
that code, and also upgrade_charm, as
mentioned in the bug report.

- pending extra unit tests
- pending upgrade test

Closes-bug: #1866145
Change-Id: I93174f23bf24c105c1f3a6e51477893e8b73074d

commit_message:
[WIP] Delete diff resources and reconfigure groups

Upon receiving new relation-set data the charm should
apply what is set in the relation as the source of
truth. To accomplish that, the charm needs to diff
out the existing resources configured to remove old
data that had been previously configured.

Additionally, new or removed VIPs need to be
added/remove from existing groups.

- pending improved unit tests
- pending upgrade test

Closes-bug: #1513889
Change-Id: I094ab81a2fe90b2fc8ff06f24b7d18cd85c77ea3

subject: proxy: always use namespaces for updating and listing
revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2024-01-04 16:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "proxy: always use namespaces for updating and listing

This patch attempts to remove confusion as to when the proxy
controllers are handling Namespace objects (or dict representations of
namespaces) vs ShardRanges.

With this patch, the proxy no longer uses ShardRanges or their dict
representation when dealing with namespaces that have been cached for
updating or listing states. Up-to-date container servers will return
more compact namespaces, and full format shard range dicts returned
from older container servers are parsed as Namespaces by the proxy.

Much of this is simply about using consistent and accurate
names. However, in some circumstances, ShardRange objects were
previously instantiated when not absolutely necessary: these are
replaced with Namespace objects.

The ObjectController would previously specify that the backend should
return full format ShardRanges when asked for updating state shard
ranges *with an includes parameter*. This isn't necessary with a
modern backend which now supports the 'includes' parameter with
'namespace' format requests. This wasn't strictly necessary with a
legacy backend, which would have returned full format ShardRanges
anyway if an 'includes' parameter was sent.

The ContainerController._get_from_shards method needs a list of
namespaces to build a sharded listing. It is currently passed a
response which has a list of either namespaces or full shard range
dicts, depending on what the backend server returned. The list of
dicts is converted to a list of ShardRange objects. This is convenient
because the ShardRange conveniently splits the namespace name into
account and container parts, but it is also confusing given that the
list will often be of namespace dicts.

This patch refactors _get_from_shards to clarify that it does not
require ShardRange objects. The method is now passed a list of
namespaces, which is parsed from the response body before the method
is called.

Some unit tests are also refactored to be more realistic when mocking
_get_from_shards.

Change-Id: I2cec1cef5eb34874feea9f2922fd13c4f011e410
"}]
commit_message:
proxy: always use namespaces for updating and listing

This patch attempts to remove confusion as to when the proxy
controllers are handling Namespace objects (or dict representations of
namespaces) vs ShardRanges.

With this patch, the proxy no longer uses ShardRanges or their dict
representation when dealing with namespaces that have been cached for
updating or listing states. Up-to-date container servers will return
more compact namespaces, and full format shard range dicts returned
from older container servers are parsed as Namespaces by the proxy.

Much of this is simply about using consistent and accurate
names. However, in some circumstances, ShardRange objects were
previously instantiated when not absolutely necessary: these are
replaced with Namespace objects.

The ObjectController would previously specify that the backend should
return full format ShardRanges when asked for updating state shard
ranges *with an includes parameter*. This isn't necessary with a
modern backend which now supports the 'includes' parameter with
'namespace' format requests. This wasn't strictly necessary with a
legacy backend, which would have returned full format ShardRanges
anyway if an 'includes' parameter was sent.

The ContainerController._get_from_shards method needs a list of
namespaces to build a sharded listing. It is currently passed a
response which has a list of either namespaces or full shard range
dicts, depending on what the backend server returned. The list of
dicts is converted to a list of ShardRange objects. This is convenient
because the ShardRange conveniently splits the namespace name into
account and container parts, but it is also confusing given that the
list will often be of namespace dicts.

This patch refactors _get_from_shards to clarify that it does not
require ShardRange objects. The method is now passed a list of
namespaces, which is parsed from the response body before the method
is called.

Some unit tests are also refactored to be more realistic when mocking
_get_from_shards.

Change-Id: I2cec1cef5eb34874feea9f2922fd13c4f011e410

subject: Fix random unit test failures
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 09:52:02.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/storage/v2/test_storage_unit.py'], 'message': "Fix random unit test failures

As per https://bugs.debian.org/1029646, Cloudkitty often fails to build
as it fails its unit tests during the package build. This error happens
randomly. Sometimes it fails, sometimes it does not fail, but it's
clearly a false positive, because we don't really want the test to fail
in such case.

This patch makes it a lot less likely (10 times less) to happen by
increasing the tolerance.

Change-Id: If217a639f9af1e2693e6a132e46033df6bf96415
(cherry picked from commit b460fd937fd2c8cc83979efa1abb7fa82d40a3f7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix random unit test failures

As per https://bugs.debian.org/1029646, Cloudkitty often fails to build
as it fails its unit tests during the package build. This error happens
randomly. Sometimes it fails, sometimes it does not fail, but it's
clearly a false positive, because we don't really want the test to fail
in such case.

This patch makes it a lot less likely (10 times less) to happen by
increasing the tolerance.

Change-Id: If217a639f9af1e2693e6a132e46033df6bf96415
(cherry picked from commit b460fd937fd2c8cc83979efa1abb7fa82d40a3f7)

commit_message:
Improve error message for wrong metrics backend

We should breadcrumb the operator into what this message means -- right
now, it looks like a programming error when in most cases this is a
configuration error.

Related-bug: 2047709
Change-Id: Ica627834f799cffbf283ee01a2b2482a607c316d

commit_message:
Fix random unit test failures

As per https://bugs.debian.org/1029646, Cloudkitty often fails to build
as it fails its unit tests during the package build. This error happens
randomly. Sometimes it fails, sometimes it does not fail, but it's
clearly a false positive, because we don't really want the test to fail
in such case.

This patch makes it a lot less likely (10 times less) to happen by
increasing the tolerance.

Change-Id: If217a639f9af1e2693e6a132e46033df6bf96415
(cherry picked from commit b460fd937fd2c8cc83979efa1abb7fa82d40a3f7)

subject: Bump bandit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-18 10:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'keystoneauth1/identity/v3/oidc.py'], 'message': "Bump bandit

Address incompatibility with Python 3.8, which happens due to the older
bandits use of the private '_ast' module instead of 'ast' [1] and the
deprecated 'Num' having been removed from the former. The bump requires
an additional nosec for a line that is misidentified as a hardcoded
password.

A note about requirements ordering is removed as it hasn't been relevant
since pip 20.3 introduced the new dependency resolver.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/commit/09b0207e2b1a2e17c0f68aee401333abeb5eef66

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icaaa3a2e24429bba5cf70c04062cfa5820c8a1bf
"}]
commit_message:
Bump bandit

Address incompatibility with Python 3.8, which happens due to the older
bandits use of the private '_ast' module instead of 'ast' [1] and the
deprecated 'Num' having been removed from the former. The bump requires
an additional nosec for a line that is misidentified as a hardcoded
password.

A note about requirements ordering is removed as it hasn't been relevant
since pip 20.3 introduced the new dependency resolver.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/commit/09b0207e2b1a2e17c0f68aee401333abeb5eef66

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icaaa3a2e24429bba5cf70c04062cfa5820c8a1bf

The names of a few configuration variables have changed in version 1.9.

Additionally,

is no longer valid.

subject: s3api: unify enforcement of max part number and handle exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2024-01-03 22:31:38.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/s3api/controllers/obj.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/s3api/test_multi_get.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/s3api/test_obj.py', 'test/s3api/test_mpu.py', 'swift/common/middleware/s3api/controllers/multi_upload.py', 'swift/common/middleware/s3api/s3request.py', 'swift/common/middleware/s3api/s3response.py', 'test/s3api/__init__.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/s3api/test_s3request.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/s3api/test_multi_upload.py'], 'message': "s3api: unify enforcement of max part number and handle exceptions

This change unifies the enforcement of the configured maximum
part number using a single method to validate partNumber. While
AWS has a limit of 10000 parts, Swift's limit is configurable
and defaults to 1000.

Additionally, if a Multi-Part Upload (MPU) exists with
a number of parts (N) greater than the configured
max_upload_part_number (M), we allow an object GET or HEAD
to have N >= partNumber > M. If a GET or HEAD to the MPU has
partNumber > N, then the error response will indicate that the
max is N, not M.

Change-Id: Ic5f54da3a4a0dba9acec73f7f46beac7ce7aac24
"}]
commit_message:
s3api: unify enforcement of max part number and handle exceptions

This change unifies the enforcement of the configured maximum
part number using a single method to validate partNumber. While
AWS has a limit of 10000 parts, Swift's limit is configurable
and defaults to 1000.

Additionally, if a Multi-Part Upload (MPU) exists with
a number of parts (N) greater than the configured
max_upload_part_number (M), we allow an object GET or HEAD
to have N >= partNumber > M. If a GET or HEAD to the MPU has
partNumber > N, then the error response will indicate that the
max is N, not M.

Change-Id: Ic5f54da3a4a0dba9acec73f7f46beac7ce7aac24

subject: Make cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-02 08:41:10.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Make cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job non-voting

The last success of cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job was seen on
2023-10-15 13:52:31[1] and since then it has been failing.

The Bad Request (400) error in the logs[2] is related to the
head_bucket method[3] we call for checking if the bucket already
exists.
The only argument passed to the head_bucket method is 'Bucket'
which is the container name and is valid syntax as per boto3
docs[4].

After 15th October, 2023, boto3 version 1.28.64 was released but
there is nothing specific in the CHANGELOG that would point to a
breaking change[5]. Even testing with boto3 version<=1.28.63 (1.28.53[6]),
the job still fails[7].

At this point, the job is blocking important changes like the swap space
patch[8] required to fix other gate jobs so it makes sense to make the
cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job non-voting until the figure out the
root cause.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bfa7ffcd2a8e43c68b5e532590ae5e43
[2] Jan 02 07:35:25.647588 np0036286390 cinder-backup[82000]: ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server cinder.backup.drivers.s3.S3ClientError: S3 client error: An error occurred (400) when calling the HeadBucket operation: Bad Request
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/71c021c501489840f92e60ba6bcce5532b451dc8/cinder/backup/drivers/s3.py#L219
[4] https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/develop/docs/source/guide/migrations3.rst#accessing-a-bucket
[5] https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/186bcbede6b2ea3512a3c4005194e2a6389cbcaa/CHANGELOG.rst#L707-L720
[6] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/904469
[7] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/904472
[8] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/901672

Change-Id: If62a229797e6d0097b00c7bfc33c37b44903a6c6
"}]
commit_message:
Make cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job non-voting

The last success of cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job was seen on
2023-10-15 13:52:31[1] and since then it has been failing.

The Bad Request (400) error in the logs[2] is related to the
head_bucket method[3] we call for checking if the bucket already
exists.
The only argument passed to the head_bucket method is 'Bucket'
which is the container name and is valid syntax as per boto3
docs[4].

After 15th October, 2023, boto3 version 1.28.64 was released but
there is nothing specific in the CHANGELOG that would point to a
breaking change[5]. Even testing with boto3 version<=1.28.63 (1.28.53[6]),
the job still fails[7].

At this point, the job is blocking important changes like the swap space
patch[8] required to fix other gate jobs so it makes sense to make the
cinder-tempest-plugin-cbak-s3 job non-voting until the figure out the
root cause.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bfa7ffcd2a8e43c68b5e532590ae5e43
[2] Jan 02 07:35:25.647588 np0036286390 cinder-backup[82000]: ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server cinder.backup.drivers.s3.S3ClientError: S3 client error: An error occurred (400) when calling the HeadBucket operation: Bad Request
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/71c021c501489840f92e60ba6bcce5532b451dc8/cinder/backup/drivers/s3.py#L219
[4] https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/develop/docs/source/guide/migrations3.rst#accessing-a-bucket
[5] https://github.com/boto/boto3/blob/186bcbede6b2ea3512a3c4005194e2a6389cbcaa/CHANGELOG.rst#L707-L720
[6] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/904469
[7] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/904472
[8] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/901672

Change-Id: If62a229797e6d0097b00c7bfc33c37b44903a6c6

commit_message:
sq: don't lie about max part number constraint

If an MPU exists with number of parts N greater than the configured
max_upload_part_number M, then we allow an object GET or HEAD to have
N >= partNumber > M. If a GET or HEAD to the MPU has partNumber > N
then the error response should say that the max is N, not M.

Change-Id: Ib627a93a828a58dfa10a64bf36b4eff356a5e7a9

commit_message:
Ensure consistent ordering of network_mappings

The provider_networks module returned the network_mappings in a random
order changing with every invocation. This returns the entries sorted
and adds a test to ensure the ordering is consistent between
invocations.

Change-Id: Iaec4534ebd8ff80cf7c7e3a1c8f187dd3990e4bc
(cherry picked from commit cccf4c03f134fbdcbe0664610064fcfc73671ad8)

commit_message:

order changing with every invocation. This returns the entries sorted
and adds a test to ensure the ordering is consistent between
invocations.

commit_message:
Move stable branch testing to oldest supported branch

Currently we test the stable branch with stable/train
which is in EM phase and also failing. Stackviz need to
test if supported branch works or not so let's test the
oldest stable supported branch. Considering stable/yoga
is going to EM/Unmaintained soon, I am adding stable/zed
job.

Change-Id: I5bf251f438317636aa0d2598718fe08a1aa97683

commit_message:
Fix long service restarts while using systemd

Some containers exiting with 143 instead of 0, but
this is still OK. This patch just allows
ExitCode 143 (SIGTERM) as fix. Details in
bugreport.

Services which exited with 143 (SIGTERM):

kolla-cron-container.service
kolla-designate_producer-container.service
kolla-keystone_fernet-container.service
kolla-letsencrypt_lego-container.service
kolla-magnum_api-container.service
kolla-mariadb_clustercheck-container.service
kolla-neutron_l3_agent-container.service
kolla-openvswitch_db-container.service
kolla-openvswitch_vswitchd-container.service
kolla-proxysql-container.service

Partial-Bug: #2048130
Change-Id: Ia8c85d03404cfb368e4013066c67acd2a2f68deb

commit_message:
Add dropdown list to select fixed subnet

When creating a cluster and the user decides to reuse an existing
network, it must also choose a subnet, otherwise the resulting
configuration may be invalid when trying to allocate a port.

Closes-Bug: #2038663
Related-Bug: #2038109
Change-Id: I08943f10418385a39eecc7b4117d162854d2d010

commit_message:
Fix permissions for base directories

With fixing linters [1] I have accidentally set incorrect mode for base directories
to 0644 while it should be 0755.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-04 16:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py'], 'message': "sq: support x-backend-override-deleted for namespace GET

We either support the header or we need to write code to return a 400
if it is sent. I'm inclined to default to it being supported with
namespaces to further reduce the difference between the namespace and
full format version of the API. The extra work is just tests, the
support is there by default anyway.

Change-Id: I298c09d9786d0c1cac950b96080179970dbdd286
"}]
commit_message:
sq: support x-backend-override-deleted for namespace GET

We either support the header or we need to write code to return a 400
if it is sent. I'm inclined to default to it being supported with
namespaces to further reduce the difference between the namespace and
full format version of the API. The extra work is just tests, the
support is there by default anyway.

Change-Id: I298c09d9786d0c1cac950b96080179970dbdd286

subject: Enforce endpoint override for services without discovery
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27900, 'name': 'Artem Goncharov', 'email': 'artem.goncharov@gmail.com', 'username': 'gtema'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-11-07 12:19:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/config/cloud_region.py', 'openstack/service_description.py'], 'message': 'Enforce endpoint override for services without discovery

Services without version discovery implemented are tricky. When user is
not using endpoint_override for those there are sporadic and often
attempts to perform version discovery on every request sent [1]. It
could be prevented as much as possible on SDK side during proxy
initialization, but when a request is sent to the proxy this is still
happening inside the keystonauth library. Forcing endpoint_override for
those help avoiding that.

Touching cloud_region triggers mypy complain, so change urllib import to
keep it happy.

[1]
https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/GBBHV2LN5S3HEUQHUQGZZ3UFEVRHQBOS/

Change-Id: I1956dfaac9ba8e3f9234cc98a36b20a330dc88f6
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce endpoint override for services without discovery

Services without version discovery implemented are tricky. When user is
not using endpoint_override for those there are sporadic and often
attempts to perform version discovery on every request sent [1]. It
could be prevented as much as possible on SDK side during proxy
initialization, but when a request is sent to the proxy this is still
happening inside the keystonauth library. Forcing endpoint_override for
those help avoiding that.

Touching cloud_region triggers mypy complain, so change urllib import to
keep it happy.

[1]
https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/GBBHV2LN5S3HEUQHUQGZZ3UFEVRHQBOS/

Change-Id: I1956dfaac9ba8e3f9234cc98a36b20a330dc88f6

subject: Add Availability Zone variables
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-03 14:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['templates/neutron.conf.j2', 'templates/dhcp_agent.ini.j2', 'tasks/providers/setup_ovs_ovn.yml', 'templates/l3_agent.ini.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron_az_support-97f3ab40bf554766.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add Availability Zone variables

At the moment the only way to configure multi-AZ support in Neutron were
config overrides, which work quite nicely with LXB/OVS scenarios. However,
with OVN changing configuration is not enough, and command that sets
up OVN Gateway should provide extra CMS option.

In order to improve AZ support in Neutron role, we add couple of variables
that control behaviour and allow to perform required configuration without
config overrides for OVS/LXB/OVN.

Co-Authored-By: Danila Balagansky <dbalagansky@me.com>
Closes-Bug: #2002040
Change-Id: Ic964329c06765176692f7b0c32f33ec46360a3fb
'}]
commit_message:
Add Availability Zone variables

At the moment the only way to configure multi-AZ support in Neutron were
config overrides, which work quite nicely with LXB/OVS scenarios. However,
with OVN changing configuration is not enough, and command that sets
up OVN Gateway should provide extra CMS option.

In order to improve AZ support in Neutron role, we add couple of variables
that control behaviour and allow to perform required configuration without
config overrides for OVS/LXB/OVN.

Co-Authored-By: Danila Balagansky <dbalagansky@me.com>
Closes-Bug: #2002040
Change-Id: Ic964329c06765176692f7b0c32f33ec46360a3fb

leader-get decodes using json, but leader-set just sets the keys. This
wasn't taken into consideration when fetching all the keys to filter for

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1153

Change-Id: I2d44ec0c43c1ecffd9ac77a1162ead4e4a01aabe

commit_message:
Fix broken v4 caching due to leader-get asymmetry

leader-get decodes using json, but leader-set just sets the keys. This
wasn't taken into consideration when fetching all the keys to filter for
cached keys when a relation is leaving.  This is resolved in this patch.


func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1153

Change-Id: I2d44ec0c43c1ecffd9ac77a1162ead4e4a01aabe
(cherry picked from commit d925ac756638ed043e33a7b47a2681dfcd8900ce)

commit_message:
Implement cert cache for vault units (v4)

This cache is used to store certificates and keys
issued by the leader unit. Non-leader units read
these certificates and keep data in their
"tls-certificates" relations up to date.
This ensures that charm units that receive certs
from vault can read from relation data of any
vault unit and receive correct data.

This patch is mostly the same as
I18aa6c9193379ea454851b6f60a8f331ef88a980
but improved to avoid LP#1896542 by removing
the section where a certificate can be reused
from cache during create_certs.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Kavanagh <alex.kavanagh@canonical.com>

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1153

Closes-Bug: #1940549
Closes-Bug: #1983269
Closes-Bug: #1845961
Related-Bug: #1896542
Change-Id: I0cca13d2042d61ffc6a7c13eccb0ec8c292020c9
(cherry picked from commit 1a1953b0ef23f724e9295505b100eca22ef9a6cd)

subject: Fix: Roll back volume status during reimage failure
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-11-28 14:21:06.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-reimage-status-rollback-eb2aa8f82a8caabc.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume_reimage.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Fix: Roll back volume status during reimage failure

When we try to reimage a volume, we update the status of
volume to 'downloading'.
We later validate the image metadata (like image is 'active',
image size is less than volume size, etc), and in case the
validation fails, we currently don't revert the volume status
back to original ('available', 'in-use' etc) and volume stays
in 'downloading' state.

This patch fixes this by catching the failure exception and
doing a DB update to restore the volume status back to it's
previous state.

Closes-Bug: #2036994
Change-Id: I05bf29e2a089b06398414b542b655a8083c9a21f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: Roll back volume status during reimage failure

When we try to reimage a volume, we update the status of
volume to 'downloading'.
We later validate the image metadata (like image is 'active',
image size is less than volume size, etc), and in case the
validation fails, we currently don't revert the volume status
back to original ('available', 'in-use' etc) and volume stays
in 'downloading' state.

This patch fixes this by catching the failure exception and
doing a DB update to restore the volume status back to it's
previous state.

Closes-Bug: #2036994
Change-Id: I05bf29e2a089b06398414b542b655a8083c9a21f

It appears that the requirements update in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/904303
might have set shallow_since incorrectly. As far as I can see this
is generally set to the day before the referenced commit. In this
case it was set to the day after.

commit isn't at the top of stable/2023.1

Change-Id: I0da61d324a09d8304a7e3371df5f21dc4774ab1a
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum/+/904508

commit_message:
Fix shallow_since for rabbitmq_server on 2023.1

It appears that the requirements update in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/904303
might have set shallow_since incorrectly. As far as I can see this
is generally set to the day before the referenced commit. In this
case it was set to the day after.

This is causing upgrade job CI failures now that the referenced
commit isn't at the top of stable/2023.1

Change-Id: I0da61d324a09d8304a7e3371df5f21dc4774ab1a
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum/+/904508

subject: Build separately for each supported series again
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-05 05:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['src/tests/bundles/focal-yoga.yaml', 'src/tests/bundles/jammy-yoga.yaml', 'src/tests/bundles/focal-xena.yaml', 'charmcraft.yaml'], 'message': 'Build separately for each supported series again

This charm is currently configured to build binary wheels which only
work on the series they are built for (--binary-wheels-from-source in
tox.ini or charmcraft.yaml).

This change was made alongside the charmcraft.yaml changes to always
build-on/run-on the same series in the following commit: b0acd923b725
("Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds")

However the charmcraft.yaml changes to build separately were incorrectly
reverted in: 75c1b2a978c5 ("Add Kinetic and Zed support")

This results in failed installations on Jammy-Yoga with the error:
Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement MarkupSafe==2.1.3

Switch charmcraft.yaml back to again build-on/run-on the same series.

Closes-Bug: #1999200
(cherry picked from commit ae32f758e81ed9120519f15a7b479a01d10d6882)
Change-Id: I732b74bd1d57dfecc2b0c724fddbb63ba3a524ce
'}]
commit_message:
Build separately for each supported series again

This charm is currently configured to build binary wheels which only
work on the series they are built for (--binary-wheels-from-source in
tox.ini or charmcraft.yaml).

This change was made alongside the charmcraft.yaml changes to always
build-on/run-on the same series in the following commit: b0acd923b725
("Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds")

However the charmcraft.yaml changes to build separately were incorrectly
reverted in: 75c1b2a978c5 ("Add Kinetic and Zed support")

This results in failed installations on Jammy-Yoga with the error:
Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement MarkupSafe==2.1.3

Switch charmcraft.yaml back to again build-on/run-on the same series.

Closes-Bug: #1999200
(cherry picked from commit ae32f758e81ed9120519f15a7b479a01d10d6882)
Change-Id: I732b74bd1d57dfecc2b0c724fddbb63ba3a524ce

commit_message:
Do not log lack of metrics support at WARNING lvl

We have some drivers, such as SNMP, which do not support metrics.
Environments with these nodes should not get "N" messages for "N" nodes
that can't generate sensor data.

Closes-bug: 2047709
Change-Id: Ibc1f3feb055521214512c8b350d67933491c2550

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-19 10:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-dhcp-record/templates/dhcp-host.j2', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-inspect-node/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-dhcp-record/templates/dns-address.j2', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-inspect-node/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-inspect-node/templates/dhcp-host.j2', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-dhcp-record/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-inspect-node/templates/dns-address.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/cleaning-dhcp-config-e693799a88f32a4e.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-dhcp-record/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-enroll-dynamic/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Configure static DHCP before automated cleaning

After the switch to newer ansible collection, the enrollment workflow
started running automated cleaning (before that, it would use the old
API version resulting in immediate "available"). However, the static
DHCP configuration only happened in the inspect and deploy workflows,
which are run after enrollment.

This change extracts a new small role for the DHCP config and includes
it in all 3 workflows that use DHCP.

While here, make sure that dnsmasq_dhcp_hostsdir is respected.

Change-Id: Idf6f24dde11d600698d45a218812cba8134fb73f
'}]
commit_message:
Configure static DHCP before automated cleaning

After the switch to newer ansible collection, the enrollment workflow
started running automated cleaning (before that, it would use the old
API version resulting in immediate "available"). However, the static
DHCP configuration only happened in the inspect and deploy workflows,
which are run after enrollment.

This change extracts a new small role for the DHCP config and includes
it in all 3 workflows that use DHCP.

While here, make sure that dnsmasq_dhcp_hostsdir is respected.

Change-Id: Idf6f24dde11d600698d45a218812cba8134fb73f

subject: Enable the no_timer_check option to be removable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-04 20:44:19.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/environment.d/10-bootloader-default-cmdline', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/README.rst'], 'message': 'Enable the no_timer_check option to be removable

Turns out, some kernels on some versions of hardware, can
fail to boot when the hardware clock timer is not explicitly
checked. Normally, with virtual machines, you want to disable
the timer check, becuase the virutal machine inherently gets time
slices, and checking the timer can create issues booting.

Co-Authored-By: Ella Shulman <eshulman@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8b9697ba60748bfe1e1e1914f24f207439cda2f1
'}]
commit_message:
Enable the no_timer_check option to be removable

Turns out, some kernels on some versions of hardware, can
fail to boot when the hardware clock timer is not explicitly
checked. Normally, with virtual machines, you want to disable
the timer check, becuase the virutal machine inherently gets time
slices, and checking the timer can create issues booting.

Co-Authored-By: Ella Shulman <eshulman@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8b9697ba60748bfe1e1e1914f24f207439cda2f1

subject: abstract bootstrap host disk partition names
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-12-19 21:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_data_disk.yml'], 'message': 'abstract bootstrap host disk partition names

The code in this playbook assumes that the path to a partition is just
the partition number appended to the disk path. However when working
with NVMe disks, the partition will actually be "pN" where N is the
partition number and p is the literal character. To attempt to be
agnostic use lsblk to show all the partitions on the disk, since it was
just reformatted and only has the partitions this playbook creates. This
is then stored in a new temporary fact that can be used throughout the
rest of the playbook.

Change-Id: I661696c275fbc2e91d049303f5498ff8d401fc83
'}]
commit_message:
abstract bootstrap host disk partition names

The code in this playbook assumes that the path to a partition is just
the partition number appended to the disk path. However when working
with NVMe disks, the partition will actually be "pN" where N is the
partition number and p is the literal character. To attempt to be
agnostic use lsblk to show all the partitions on the disk, since it was
just reformatted and only has the partitions this playbook creates. This
is then stored in a new temporary fact that can be used throughout the
rest of the playbook.

Change-Id: I661696c275fbc2e91d049303f5498ff8d401fc83

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-04 11:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_backup.py', 'tempest/api/volume/base.py'], 'message': 'Use lowercase names for swift/S3 containers

The cinder backup tests are currently failing with the swift s3api
backend because it is invalid for S3 to have uppercase letters in a

commit_message:
Use lowercase names for swift/S3 containers

The cinder backup tests are currently failing with the swift s3api
backend because it is invalid for S3 to have uppercase letters in a
bucket name. Use all lowercase instead.

Change-Id: Ifa2f9779af102dc1faf6488332e14aadb8d29bc0

[mariadb-operator] Enable auto-upgrade

This PS enables auto-upgrade feature from official mariadb docker
entrypoint script.

Also switching mariadb image to the official from docker.io/mariadb
repo and adding temp volime mount to mariadb-server pods created by
mariadb-operator.

commit_message:
Add 2 new projects to the airship namespace (armada-go & operator)

The armada-operator is a k8s operator to manage Helm chart releases
with Armada charts as k8s manifests.

The armada-go project is designed to manage collection of k8s
manifests, including Armada charts, to streamline their lifecycle.

Change-Id: I8b1527e99198032d0035fea0f454c8ee6848e050
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary 'type: ignore' comments

The mypy job complaints about 'exc' variable[1] since it was used
for ExceptionChainer as well as TargetPortalNotFound exception.
Changing the variable name for TargetPortalNotFound exception from
'exc' to 'target_exc' makes the 'type: ignore' comments unnecessary.

[1] Trying to read deleted variable 'exc'

Change-Id: I4b10db0754f0e00bb02d3a60f9aaf88b90466a8f

commit_message:
cinder_type: Fix regex for properties to accept short value

This fixes the regex to validate the properties property so that value
strings shorter than 3 characters are accepted.

This also removes the heading spaces because these are not stripped but
added to the keys, which likely results in an unexpected result.

Change-Id: I8d703a48060abb61834ecec9c72bb6295eff2b81
(cherry picked from commit 0f500ef7da98b9579f801132f70e030e8d56922f)

subject: set startupProbe in nova compute
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2024-01-04 14:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/values.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/nova.yaml', 'nova/templates/daemonset-compute.yaml', 'nova/Chart.yaml'], 'message': 'set startupProbe in nova compute

In environments where there is a large number of ports (100+) on a
hypervisor, the start up can take a long time, and eventually the
liveness test will fail because the process is stuck plugging ports
in.
No need initial delay for live/readiness probe and Startup probe
is enough

Change-Id: I54544a45a716fa4ff840019c0526343063ed1ac5
'}]
commit_message:
set startupProbe in nova compute

In environments where there is a large number of ports (100+) on a
hypervisor, the start up can take a long time, and eventually the
liveness test will fail because the process is stuck plugging ports
in.
No need initial delay for live/readiness probe and Startup probe
is enough

Change-Id: I54544a45a716fa4ff840019c0526343063ed1ac5

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6f18713ff952bec999f9181c3d719085e2f645dc

Currently, no handling is done for the 2nd request (we catch HTTPError,

commit_message:
Handle exceptions after re-authentication

Currently, no handling is done for the 2nd request (we catch HTTPError,
but it won't be raised without raise_for_exceptions). Recurse into
the same call instead.

Change-Id: I9d593a741344fd7d5d6d59eca48a12222572c1ce

subject: TypeError: 'OSError' object is not subscriptable raised when terminate senlin-api process unexpectedly
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2024-01-04 04:22:27.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/api/common/test_wsgi.py', 'senlin/api/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "TypeError: 'OSError' object is not subscriptable raised when terminate senlin-api process unexpectedly

When terminate senlin-api process the `evenlet.wsgi.server` raised OSError exception that is not a list or a tuple which make TypeError raised and the senlin-api process may not be terminated properly

Closes-Bug: #2047914
Change-Id: Id02befe51e9118c8d8dafc3c926398fbf7e1258e
"}]
commit_message:
TypeError: 'OSError' object is not subscriptable raised when terminate senlin-api process unexpectedly

When terminate senlin-api process the `evenlet.wsgi.server` raised OSError exception that is not a list or a tuple which make TypeError raised and the senlin-api process may not be terminated properly

Closes-Bug: #2047914
Change-Id: Id02befe51e9118c8d8dafc3c926398fbf7e1258e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2024-01-04 12:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/specs/2024.1/index.rst', 'specs/2024.1/approved/unify-ceph-nova-compute-credentials.rst'], 'message': 'Unify ceph nova-compute credentials

Ceph credentials should be the same across all nova-compute charm apps
to allow live-migration of VMs booted from image (and stored in ceph
via use of libvirt-image-backend=rbd config) to succeed.

Related-bug: #2028559
Change-Id: If73469af2a372c0afbdbf338677782d475fd02e2
'}]
commit_message:
Unify ceph nova-compute credentials

Ceph credentials should be the same across all nova-compute charm apps
to allow live-migration of VMs booted from image (and stored in ceph
via use of libvirt-image-backend=rbd config) to succeed.

Related-bug: #2028559
Change-Id: If73469af2a372c0afbdbf338677782d475fd02e2

commit_message:
fix: ovn-metadata-agent '/run/netns' mountPropagation overrides by parent directory.

When there is a backlog of notifications to be sent, it is possible
that ovsdb-server will merge insert and update notifications. Due
to this, we need to handle the situation where we see a Port_Binding

'}]
commit_message:
Handle creation of Port_Binding with chassis set

When there is a backlog of notifications to be sent, it is possible
that ovsdb-server will merge insert and update notifications. Due
to this, we need to handle the situation where we see a Port_Binding
created with the chassis set.

Closes-Bug: #2017748

Change-Id: Idfae87cf6c60e9e18ede91ea20857cea5322738c

commit_message:
Remove legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr

While cleaning up after End of Life transition of stable/train of nova
a patch was proposed to remove unused legacy jobs. It turned out that a
legacy job (legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-libvirt-kvm-apr) is still used by
x/devstack-plugin-additional-pkg-repos project. This project looks like
a long abandoned old project, so this patch proposes to remove the job
anyway.

Change-Id: I155669196b0c1f4694685760117f422c06b3a5cd

subject: Remove stein branch from periodic-stable templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-03 13:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project-templates.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove stein branch from periodic-stable templates

All the project that had periodic-stable-jobs template set in their
stable/stein branch have transitioned to End of Life, and their
branches were deleted [1]. This patch removes stable/stein from the
template as it is not needed anymore.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: Ia61395c84da047e2a8747e6b1ac6fdaf2c19286e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove stein branch from periodic-stable templates

All the project that had periodic-stable-jobs template set in their
stable/stein branch have transitioned to End of Life, and their
branches were deleted [1]. This patch removes stable/stein from the
template as it is not needed anymore.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: Ia61395c84da047e2a8747e6b1ac6fdaf2c19286e

commit_message:
Enable the option to return the response body

As part of our efforts to enhance automation and CI for Manila,
we have begun developing code in the Tobiko tool to support the
Manila client. During create/get operations, we have observed
that the returned body contains solely the resource id in the
format <Share: <id>>.
To address this, we are introducing a patch that allows retrieving
the full body response, not just the id resource.

This cherry-pick includes the change
I4c1c1e089a726608124693c13eca73ce12fd5b8e
(commit 2f6cd660c61ef22f96db65de94dd5f9212937f9d) from the
stable/2023.2 branch. Since both changes are closely related,
and resolve the same issue, we could squash the changes into
one submission for ease of back porting.

Change-Id: Ia15274e75aa5d3da04d861a64a2f437cd4a9a584
(cherry picked from commit 47b0ac7d593acce86e5cfae58dcab37abc45ff24)
(cherry picked from commit 3abf89da1b7106565a833b61d09b59b6be39132d)
(cherry picked from commit 6e494f137b27d6a378d5410f3df6c34afb6e6c2f)
(cherry picked from commit a1bba8aefa883f37431ba17e307e6ea60c40bf4f)

commit_message:
Enable the option to return the response body

As part of our efforts to enhance automation and CI for Manila,
we have begun developing code in the Tobiko tool to support the
Manila client. During create/get operations, we have observed
that the returned body contains solely the resource id in the
format <Share: <id>>.
To address this, we are introducing a patch that allows retrieving
the full body response, not just the id resource.

This cherry-pick includes the change
I4c1c1e089a726608124693c13eca73ce12fd5b8e
(commit 2f6cd660c61ef22f96db65de94dd5f9212937f9d) from the
stable/2023.2 branch. Since both changes are closely related,
and resolve the same issue, we could squash the changes into

Change-Id: I9d8495221337e7eef091432d0cabdd7ff7654d78

commit_message:
Do not display num_agents if ovn binary is used

Do not display num_agents if ovn binary is used as the count
will always be 0.  Perhaps another suitable method of fixing
this would be to add a boolean setting to enable/disable the
listing of number of dhcp agents or remove this entirely.

Change-Id: I9d8495221337e7eef091432d0cabdd7ff7654d78

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-08 17:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/train/glance-store.yaml', 'deliverables/train/glance.yaml', 'deliverables/train/python-glanceclient.yaml'], 'message': "[glance] Transition Train to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: I805e9e69ca0deab59953b9012821e5e9bf7ecb1a
"}]
commit_message:
[glance] Transition Train to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: I805e9e69ca0deab59953b9012821e5e9bf7ecb1a

subject: [OpenStackAnsible] Transition Stein to End of Life
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2024-01-03 15:00:31.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/stein/openstack-ansible.yaml'], 'message': "[OpenStackAnsible] Transition Stein to End of Life

As announced on mailing list [1], this patch transitions the Stein
branch to End of Life. The last patch of the branch will be tagged with
stein-eol tag. stable/stein branch cannot be used anymore and will be
deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/stein is not actively maintained in recent
period, thus gates are mostly broken due to job failures. Besides,
by removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/stein is deleted. Propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: Ib7f583f526db7a33193f77efc39fc61bd7382196
"}]
commit_message:
[OpenStackAnsible] Transition Stein to End of Life

As announced on mailing list [1], this patch transitions the Stein
branch to End of Life. The last patch of the branch will be tagged with
stein-eol tag. stable/stein branch cannot be used anymore and will be
deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/stein is not actively maintained in recent
period, thus gates are mostly broken due to job failures. Besides,
by removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/stein is deleted. Propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: Ib7f583f526db7a33193f77efc39fc61bd7382196

commit_message:
Metadata: handle process exceptions

Both metadata agents (OVN and non-OVN) should handle
process exceptions when spawning haproxy processes
such that the agent can continue its operation for
other haproxy processes.

Closes-Bug: #2033305
Change-Id: I6da1b135c83ecfc41ec91e907ebf8500325a7a80
(cherry picked from commit ed0515737be75745933f4994b5e6b652f9e0a2be)

subject: Fix compatibility with subunit >= 1.4.3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-20 14:24:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/index.rst', 'doc/source/user/history.rst', 'os_testr/subunit_trace.py'], 'message': "Fix compatibility with subunit >= 1.4.3

The subunit.test_results module is no longer imported by the top-level
subunit module and we have to explicitly import it.

This also fixes the broken doc build caused by the history.rst file.
The change log is now maintained differently so we don't need it
any more.

Closes-Bug: #2045766
Change-Id: Iae1ae0c55b8e1660a2bb41379a1f8f8506679cca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compatibility with subunit >= 1.4.3

The subunit.test_results module is no longer imported by the top-level
subunit module and we have to explicitly import it.

This also fixes the broken doc build caused by the history.rst file.
The change log is now maintained differently so we don't need it
any more.

Closes-Bug: #2045766
Change-Id: Iae1ae0c55b8e1660a2bb41379a1f8f8506679cca

subject: Remove support for in-place upgrades with the Heat driver.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2023-12-20 08:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/drivers/test_k8s_fedora_atomic_v1_driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/upgrade-api-heat-removal-300f15d863515257.yaml', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/cluster_conductor.py', 'magnum/drivers/heat/driver.py'], 'message': 'Remove support for in-place upgrades with the Heat driver.

Heat stack SoftwareConfig is unable to provide a reliable upgrade
experience, so is being disabled. More details in code comments.

A Cluster API driver provides a way forward for Magnum to support
these again, and implement upgrade_cluster.

Change-Id: Ibea354ebfe36e8d689a95c30820709ec2b633964
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for in-place upgrades with the Heat driver.

Heat stack SoftwareConfig is unable to provide a reliable upgrade
experience, so is being disabled. More details in code comments.

A Cluster API driver provides a way forward for Magnum to support
these again, and implement upgrade_cluster.

Change-Id: Ibea354ebfe36e8d689a95c30820709ec2b633964

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2020-03-29 16:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_base.py', 'releasenotes/notes/pxe-wholedisk-boot-default-to-disk-6436ea4b4441319e.yaml'], 'message': 'if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

*** This change makes sense for something backportable, but
since the default boot mode has been changed in master branch
it may no longer make sense to proceed with.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103
'}]
commit_message:
if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

*** This change makes sense for something backportable, but
since the default boot mode has been changed in master branch
it may no longer make sense to proceed with.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2024-01-02 05:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['tests/bundles/lunar-antelope.yaml', 'tests/bundles/jammy-antelope.yaml', 'src/charm.py', 'tests/bundles/mantic-bobcat.yaml', 'tests/bundles/jammy-bobcat.yaml', 'unit_tests/test_ceph_dashboard_charm.py'], 'message': 'Use single credential for configuring object storage gw in dashboard.

The radosgw relation provides the same credential mapped to the
hostnames of all the related radosgw application units. This extra
information is not needed. Even when multiple radosgw applications
are present in the same Juju model, a single instance of credentials
is sufficient for dashbaord to present Object GW UI.

Closes-Bug: #1986593
Change-Id: Ib56e0bd4fe588219d6b5728d9a71cf09abdd25de
Signed-off-by: Utkarsh Bhatt <utkarsh.bhatt@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use single credential for configuring object storage gw in dashboard.

The radosgw relation provides the same credential mapped to the
hostnames of all the related radosgw application units. This extra
information is not needed. Even when multiple radosgw applications
are present in the same Juju model, a single instance of credentials
is sufficient for dashbaord to present Object GW UI.

Closes-Bug: #1986593
Change-Id: Ib56e0bd4fe588219d6b5728d9a71cf09abdd25de
Signed-off-by: Utkarsh Bhatt <utkarsh.bhatt@canonical.com>

Document allowed_digests for formpost middleware

This change implements and enables by default quorum support
for rabbitmq as well as providing default variables to globally tune
it's behaviour.

In order to ensure upgrade path and ability to switch back to HA queues
we change vhost names with removing leading `/`, as enabling quorum
requires to remove exchange which is tricky thing to do with running
services.

Change-Id: I2e3f464534bffe9edd9d969c8d6a24adce06c02c
"}]
commit_message:
Add quorum queues support for service

This change implements and enables by default quorum support
for rabbitmq as well as providing default variables to globally tune
it's behaviour.

In order to ensure upgrade path and ability to switch back to HA queues
we change vhost names with removing leading `/`, as enabling quorum
requires to remove exchange which is tricky thing to do with running
services.

Change-Id: I2e3f464534bffe9edd9d969c8d6a24adce06c02c

commit_message:
Mark Sahara project Inactive

This project is not healthy as their gate is broken
and release pacthes, zuul config error are not fixed/merged.

We have been appointing the PTL for this project since last
three cycle (including 2024.1 cycle)
- https://github.com/openstack/governance/blob/a7794998c1f0e1c0cd80df75f0d76150d758901c/reference/projects.yaml#L2460

TC discussed about this project in this cycle PTL appointment
and as per the project health and their repo gate status, we
are marking it as Inactive.
- https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/2024.1-leaderless

There is time till milestone-2 of this release cycle to recover
the situstion and make project healthy and we can remove it from
inactive list. Refer to the below doc to know more about Inactive
state

- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/emerging-technology-and-inactive-projects.html

Add bugfixed version of ceph_crush_rule module

Due to the bug [1] in ceph-ansible we're unable to setup and test MDS
In order to unblock ourselves with Manila and other testing, we
propose fixed version of the module, that will be used later on with OSA
playbooks to setup MDS.

There is currently a bug[1] in ceph-ansible, as it was never designed to
work with ansible-core 2.15, which prevents from MDS to be setup

Until upstream module fix is merged, we workaround that by placing

commit_message:
Use ops ceph collection for MDS deployment

There is currently a bug[1] in ceph-ansible, as it was never designed to
work with ansible-core 2.15, which prevents from MDS to be setup
correctly due to rather minor issue.

Until upstream module fix is merged, we workaround that by placing
"fixed" module into ops collection, and providing the collection
priority for loading module over the ceph-ansible ones.

This should also unblock our CI for manila.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/7466

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/+/902058
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/901471
Change-Id: I923dd83668be7e57e5afa44dd25a1e893d11fdc7

subject: Skip installing curl for EL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'message': 'Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d
'}]
commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d

commit_message:
Persist Neutron agent state files in volume

The Neutron L3 agent stores state at state_path (/var/lib/neutron by
default) and it is expected that these files persist across restarts.

This change updates the Neutron state_path value to
/var/lib/neutron/kolla (which is where the neutron_metadata_socket
volume is mounted) so that these state files are stored there.

Change-Id: I739aaf9e2d0b2b2e7f7b8f60ef8c2111d6873cef
Signed-off-by: Adam Oswick <adam@adamoswick.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #2009884
(cherry picked from commit 25244517e162a02e73503c56f9f370f9a71a1f7d)

The Neutron L3 agent stores state at state_path (/var/lib/neutron by

subject: Allow setting the image format of the image
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-19 12:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['src/config.yaml', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/octavia_diskimage_retrofit.py'], 'message': 'Allow setting the image format of the image

After the image is retrofited, we need to be able to set the image
format to be uploaded back to Glance. On systems that leverage Ceph or
any other storage appliance that uses raw as its native storage format,
this allows fast CoW VM disk creation. It also means that if
force-raw-images is set to true, nova will no longer download the image,
convert it to raw and copy it to the storage backend before creating the
VM. This saves a lot of bandwidth and time.

Closes-Bug: #2037557

Change-Id: I4eb62e330584635ccecd06c9ccac691723ea20b7
Signed-off-by: Gabriel Adrian Samfira <gsamfira@cloudbasesolutions.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow setting the image format of the image

After the image is retrofited, we need to be able to set the image
format to be uploaded back to Glance. On systems that leverage Ceph or
any other storage appliance that uses raw as its native storage format,
this allows fast CoW VM disk creation. It also means that if
force-raw-images is set to true, nova will no longer download the image,
convert it to raw and copy it to the storage backend before creating the
VM. This saves a lot of bandwidth and time.

Closes-Bug: #2037557

Change-Id: I4eb62e330584635ccecd06c9ccac691723ea20b7
Signed-off-by: Gabriel Adrian Samfira <gsamfira@cloudbasesolutions.com>

subject: Remove `localhost` record from hosts file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:04:30.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do_not_add_localhost_to_hosts-36e365b95dc9da42.yaml', 'tasks/openstack_update_hosts_file.yml'], 'message': 'Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)

subject: Skip installing curl for EL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:53:43.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'message': 'Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d
'}]
commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d

commit_message:
Metadata: handle process exceptions

Both metadata agents (OVN and non-OVN) should handle
process exceptions when spawning haproxy processes
such that the agent can continue its operation for
other haproxy processes.

Closes-Bug: #2033305
Change-Id: I6da1b135c83ecfc41ec91e907ebf8500325a7a80
(cherry picked from commit 824a8257a88d7192ecd4a5efdcd1dba46d63d82b)

commit_message:
Metadata: handle process exceptions

Both metadata agents (OVN and non-OVN) should handle
process exceptions when spawning haproxy processes
such that the agent can continue its operation for
other haproxy processes.

Note:
neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py#L836
Added `mock.call.get_pid_file_name()` to the expected
list of process calls. This call was removed in stable/2031.1
and later.
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/903149

Closes-Bug: #2033305
Change-Id: I6da1b135c83ecfc41ec91e907ebf8500325a7a80
(cherry picked from commit ed0515737be75745933f4994b5e6b652f9e0a2be)

commit_message:
Metadata: handle process exceptions

Both metadata agents (OVN and non-OVN) should handle
process exceptions when spawning haproxy processes
such that the agent can continue its operation for
other haproxy processes.

Closes-Bug: #2033305
Change-Id: I6da1b135c83ecfc41ec91e907ebf8500325a7a80
(cherry picked from commit 4698dd899fa149088160372b6f2efcd3ce973cbb)

subject: Remove `localhost` record from hosts file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do_not_add_localhost_to_hosts-36e365b95dc9da42.yaml', 'tasks/openstack_update_hosts_file.yml'], 'message': 'Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)

commit_message:
Remove nova cell sync comment

Removed a comment suggesting we use nova-manage db sync --local_cell
when bootstrapping the nova service, since that suggestion has now been
implemented in Kolla. See [1] for more details.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/902057

Related-Bug: #2045558
Depends-On: Ic64eb51325b3503a14ebab9b9ff2f4d9caec734a
Change-Id: I591f83c4886f5718e36011982c77c0ece6c4cbd7

subject: Skip installing curl for EL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'message': 'Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d
'}]
commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d

subject: Sync rabbitmq version to 3.11.13 for debian
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-28 11:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['vars/debian.yml'], 'message': "Sync rabbitmq version to 3.11.13 for debian

In previous patch [1] we've updated RabbitMQ version for Rocky while
version for Ubuntu was not updated, which might lead to inconsistencies
for cross-distro installations.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/904100

Change-Id: Ic91c7e96c10ba07ca686f8ff2dfdd6c7e7beba2b
"}]
commit_message:
Sync rabbitmq version to 3.11.13 for debian

In previous patch [1] we've updated RabbitMQ version for Rocky while
version for Ubuntu was not updated, which might lead to inconsistencies
for cross-distro installations.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/904100

Change-Id: Ic91c7e96c10ba07ca686f8ff2dfdd6c7e7beba2b

subject: Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-22 09:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_securitygroup.py', 'neutron/objects/securitygroup.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``

This method populates the SG rules in a dictionary. Each SG rule
inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each
SG rule was isuing a database call to retrieve the SG register.

In this patch, the SG "stateful" retrieval is done in one database
query for all SG. That improves the performance of this method
reducing the database access to only one single call.

This improvement, as commented in the LP bug, affects to
ML2/LinuxBridge. ML2/OVS agent uses a cached RPC implementation
that not requires to perform any RPC call/database query.

Conflicts:
    neutron/objects/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #2045950
Change-Id: Iafd0419a1d1eeb25d5589edc2570ebf287450957
(cherry picked from commit 6b6abb9698318a0b5db09f0c4d30a47438a94643)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``

This method populates the SG rules in a dictionary. Each SG rule
inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each
SG rule was isuing a database call to retrieve the SG register.

In this patch, the SG "stateful" retrieval is done in one database
query for all SG. That improves the performance of this method
reducing the database access to only one single call.

This improvement, as commented in the LP bug, affects to
ML2/LinuxBridge. ML2/OVS agent uses a cached RPC implementation
that not requires to perform any RPC call/database query.

Conflicts:
    neutron/objects/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #2045950
Change-Id: Iafd0419a1d1eeb25d5589edc2570ebf287450957
(cherry picked from commit 6b6abb9698318a0b5db09f0c4d30a47438a94643)

commit_message:
Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``

This method populates the SG rules in a dictionary. Each SG rule
inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each
SG rule was isuing a database call to retrieve the SG register.

In this patch, the SG "stateful" retrieval is done in one database
query for all SG. That improves the performance of this method
reducing the database access to only one single call.

This improvement, as commented in the LP bug, affects to
ML2/LinuxBridge. ML2/OVS agent uses a cached RPC implementation
that not requires to perform any RPC call/database query.

Conflicts:
    neutron/objects/securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #2045950
Change-Id: Iafd0419a1d1eeb25d5589edc2570ebf287450957
(cherry picked from commit 6b6abb9698318a0b5db09f0c4d30a47438a94643)
(cherry picked from commit 7ac9edac80132577ab285484cd48f9a859153350)

inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each

The Neutron "port.status" field ("ACTIVE", "DOWN") is set depending on

commit_message:
[OVN] Set the Neutron port status based on "lsp.up" and "lsp.enabled"

The Neutron "port.status" field ("ACTIVE", "DOWN") is set depending on
the Logical Switch Port "up" and "enabled" flags. Before this patch,
the "port.status" depended only on the "up" flag. However, the user
can set the "port.admin_state_up" field that will modify the
"lsp.enabled" flag. If the "port.admin_state_up" is DOWN, the port
does not transmit and the status should be "DOWN".

The OVN backend is correctly disabling the port transmission; what
was incorrect in the Neutron API is only the "port.status" field.

This is currently working in other mechanism drivers like LB or OVS.

NOTE: this backport also includes [1], that is updating the release
note section to "fixes".

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/903863

Closes-Bug: #2036705
Change-Id: I5b7b55b0b365df7246a571cea97a392cdf89bdb6
(cherry picked from commit aead4aa99df4769462ec47045c8d973ae1b0a0a0)
(cherry picked from commit d084f2724d57eed4e49442787126c98d95b6bf7b)

commit_message:
[OVN] Set the Neutron port status based on "lsp.up" and "lsp.enabled"

The Neutron "port.status" field ("ACTIVE", "DOWN") is set depending on
the Logical Switch Port "up" and "enabled" flags. Before this patch,
the "port.status" depended only on the "up" flag. However, the user
can set the "port.admin_state_up" field that will modify the
"lsp.enabled" flag. If the "port.admin_state_up" is DOWN, the port
does not transmit and the status should be "DOWN".

The OVN backend is correctly disabling the port transmission; what
was incorrect in the Neutron API is only the "port.status" field.

This is currently working in other mechanism drivers like LB or OVS.

NOTE: this backport also includes [1], that is updating the release
note section to "fixes".

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/903863

Closes-Bug: #2036705
Change-Id: I5b7b55b0b365df7246a571cea97a392cdf89bdb6
(cherry picked from commit aead4aa99df4769462ec47045c8d973ae1b0a0a0)

commit_message:
Support image volume cache options

This introduces support for the options to customize the image volume
cache feature. This feature is added to the default class as well as
the defined resource type for each volume driver, so that users can
configure the global options as well as the backend specific options.

Note that rbd driver and vmware driver are intentionally excluded,
because for these drivers the specific image store drivers are more
popular method to use in-storage copy when creating a volume from
an image.

Change-Id: I09480346f3a2f05b5ab0aad7033f1b37a31648db

subject: Revert "[horizon-k8s] comment memcache configuration"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-02 17:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['charms/horizon-k8s/src/templates/local_settings.py.j2'], 'message': 'Revert "[horizon-k8s] comment memcache configuration"

This reverts commit 41345c8271972f9be375b8bbad0d6ce20bc23bfc.

Reason for revert: Original issue was caused because python3-memcache was not provided anymore inside the ROCK. Commenting configuration introduces an other regression. A new version of the ROCK was published with python3-memcache.

Change-Id: I90455ca40465fad347894cd8729bde9fa31adefa
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "[horizon-k8s] comment memcache configuration"

This reverts commit 41345c8271972f9be375b8bbad0d6ce20bc23bfc.

Reason for revert: Original issue was caused because python3-memcache was not provided anymore inside the ROCK. Commenting configuration introduces an other regression. A new version of the ROCK was published with python3-memcache.

Change-Id: I90455ca40465fad347894cd8729bde9fa31adefa
