subject: tests: Fix call assertion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 20:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': "tests: Fix call assertion

Under py312, MagicMock.has_calls raises an AttributeError. This is
actually a good thing, as previously we weren't actually making the
assertions we thought we were making.

Fix the one place that we forgot the leading `assert_`, and switch it
to `any_order=True`; this is required for the test to pass, as there
are additional calls between the two expected calls.

See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/1d4d677d

Change-Id: Ia2ff2f198b4c1312a3e7dce32f11b87050683d45
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Fix call assertion

Under py312, MagicMock.has_calls raises an AttributeError. This is
actually a good thing, as previously we weren't actually making the
assertions we thought we were making.

Fix the one place that we forgot the leading `assert_`, and switch it
to `any_order=True`; this is required for the test to pass, as there
are additional calls between the two expected calls.

See https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/1d4d677d

Change-Id: Ia2ff2f198b4c1312a3e7dce32f11b87050683d45

subject: Dell EMC: PowerMax - Configurable SRDF snapshots
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 19:39:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/fc.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-powermax-protected-snap-82eb6731553356d9.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/rest.py'], 'message': "Dell EMC: PowerMax - Configurable SRDF snapshots

Add 'powermax:disable_protected_snap' setting

When set to True, snapshot won't be replicated and won't
match the source volume type, it will be a regular device
no matter what.

If set to False (default value) then the way cinder will
handle won't change from what it's currently doing for now.

Change-Id: I04e2213b394c979e2233ba2b8767a54193a03874
"}]
commit_message:
Dell EMC: PowerMax - Configurable SRDF snapshots

Add 'powermax:disable_protected_snap' setting

When set to True, snapshot won't be replicated and won't
match the source volume type, it will be a regular device
no matter what.

If set to False (default value) then the way cinder will
handle won't change from what it's currently doing for now.

Change-Id: I04e2213b394c979e2233ba2b8767a54193a03874

commit_message:
Improve platform mocking

Patch out charmhelpers.osplatform.get_platform() and
charmhelpers.core.host.lsb_release() globally in the unit tests to
insulate the unit tests from the platform that the unit tests are being
run on.

commit_message:
Fix wrong source to define volume_backend_name

The volume_backend_name property in volume types should be set
according to the volume_backend_name option, instead of the backend
config section name.

This change ensures the option value is used consistently among all
defined resource types to manage volume backend options.

Change-Id: I29c5bcdb0e79f6f98d272995de6a86a0062cea48

When syncing hostname and physical networks, filter neutron

with agent 'OVN Controller agent' should be cleaned up.

Since change: I935186b6ee95f0cae8dc05869d9742c8fb3353c3 there

If the OVN DB sync clears/deletes mappings for hosts owned by

Change-Id: Iaf15e560e1b1ec31618b2ebc6206a938463c1094

commit_message:
[OVN] DB sync host/physnet - filter on agent_type

When syncing hostname and physical networks, filter neutron
hosts on agent_type. Only segmenthostmappings for hosts
with agent 'OVN Controller agent' should be cleaned up.

Since change: I935186b6ee95f0cae8dc05869d9742c8fb3353c3 there
is de-duplication of segmenthostmapping updates from agents.
If the OVN DB sync clears/deletes mappings for hosts owned by
other agents/plugins the mappings are never re-created.

Closes-Bug: #2040172

Change-Id: Iaf15e560e1b1ec31618b2ebc6206a938463c1094
Signed-off-by: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71d69cf6277ba553354512209a2bff61c013f8ea)

subject: Remove obsolete PID files before start
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-12-19 09:55:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_external_process.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_driver.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/external_process.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/driver.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovn/metadata/test_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'message': 'Remove obsolete PID files before start

External processes, such as radvd, can refuse to start
and throw an exception such as:

  "Unable to convert value in $pidfile"

because the given pidfile has more than one PID in it.
The situation can happen when the neutron node is reset
and the obsolete PID files are not cleaned before neutron
is started.

This commit adds PID file cleanup before external
process start.

Closes-bug: #2033980
Change-Id: Id62bf18067d0b144c3e8825c7603cc1e51dca052
(cherry picked from commit c3b855a10080ab5b7d33f42aaee02e5ed50a4fdf)
Signed-off-by: Sven Kieske <kieske@osism.tech>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete PID files before start

External processes, such as radvd, can refuse to start
and throw an exception such as:

  "Unable to convert value in $pidfile"

because the given pidfile has more than one PID in it.
The situation can happen when the neutron node is reset
and the obsolete PID files are not cleaned before neutron
is started.

This commit adds PID file cleanup before external
process start.

Closes-bug: #2033980
Change-Id: Id62bf18067d0b144c3e8825c7603cc1e51dca052
(cherry picked from commit c3b855a10080ab5b7d33f42aaee02e5ed50a4fdf)
Signed-off-by: Sven Kieske <kieske@osism.tech>

subject: Remove `localhost` record from hosts file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-30 07:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do_not_add_localhost_to_hosts-36e365b95dc9da42.yaml', 'tasks/openstack_update_hosts_file.yml'], 'message': 'Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting

in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)

commit_message:
Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
(cherry picked from commit 2e78c2314d65229810ad203419243962074c9246)

subject: Simplify the tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-06 03:57:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Simplify the tox.ini

Tox creates implicit testenvs based upon the conventional naming
of the testenv. For example, tox -epy310 will implicitly create a
[testenv:py310] target and attempt to use the python3.10 interpreter.
By moving the deps and the basepython to the root [testenv] section,
this will specify the defaults which will be inherited by all of the
additional testenvs. This allows for the elimintation of testenvs
that are defined only to indicate which python interpreter to use.

Tox will produce a warning if the python conflicts with the target
python, so tell it to ignore this condition.

Change-Id: Ia900c07d6261efd01465ffdd67ba9aadf2eea9a7
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify the tox.ini

Tox creates implicit testenvs based upon the conventional naming
of the testenv. For example, tox -epy310 will implicitly create a
[testenv:py310] target and attempt to use the python3.10 interpreter.
By moving the deps and the basepython to the root [testenv] section,
this will specify the defaults which will be inherited by all of the
additional testenvs. This allows for the elimintation of testenvs
that are defined only to indicate which python interpreter to use.

Tox will produce a warning if the python conflicts with the target
python, so tell it to ignore this condition.

Change-Id: Ia900c07d6261efd01465ffdd67ba9aadf2eea9a7

subject: cinder_type: Fix regex for properties to accept short value
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-25 03:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/cinder_type.rb', 'spec/acceptance/10_basic_cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': 'cinder_type: Fix regex for properties to accept short value

This fixes the regex to validate the properties property so that value
strings shorter than 3 characters are accepted.

'}]
commit_message:
cinder_type: Fix regex for properties to accept short value

This fixes the regex to validate the properties property so that value
strings shorter than 3 characters are accepted.

This also removes the heading spaces because these are not stripped but
added to the keys, which likely results in an unexpected result.

Change-Id: I8d703a48060abb61834ecec9c72bb6295eff2b81

WIP s3api: enforce configured max part num

AWS has a limit of 10000 parts but swift's limit is configurable and
defaults to 1000.

commit_message:
Fix wsrep sync status task while switched to TCP/IP

Followup on Id6eae798784126d4dd53adef15bdce6b47b4601f to fix an issue
when a client with provided port set tries to connect 'localhost', so
while we switch to TCP/IP we need to explicitly provide the host too.

Partial-Bug: #2024554
Change-Id: Ib08c159dadd69a1f44924d658f4afe1e794a18b0
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2023-12-28 06:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['senlin_dashboard/api/senlin.py'], 'message': 'Adding CACERT and NO_VERIFY option on senlinclient

When deploy openstack with selfsigned CA cert, the senlin-dashboard unable to fetch required data.
Adding `cacert = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT` and `insecure = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY` to build ks_session.Session suitable for current environment and fix SSL Error issue

Closes-Bug: #2047622
Change-Id: I949871801d147a14b53696d3ebad79f0b4c8d3a7
'}]
commit_message:
Adding CACERT and NO_VERIFY option on senlinclient

When deploy openstack with selfsigned CA cert, the senlin-dashboard unable to fetch required data.
Adding `cacert = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT` and `insecure = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY` to build ks_session.Session suitable for current environment and fix SSL Error issue

Closes-Bug: #2047622
Change-Id: I949871801d147a14b53696d3ebad79f0b4c8d3a7

revisions:

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: I5bca6ae2112073d50cd38e9ef46333a139528ed6
"}]
commit_message:
[zun] Transition Train to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: I5bca6ae2112073d50cd38e9ef46333a139528ed6

As announced on mailing list [1], this patch transitions the Stein

Change-Id: I5deb2c0958fd0d49d32de93503a886af8ba3e429

commit_message:
[Quality Assurance] Transition Stein to End of Life

As announced on mailing list [1], this patch transitions the Stein
branch to End of Life. The last patch of the branch will be tagged with
stein-eol tag. stable/stein branch cannot be used anymore and will be
deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/stein is not actively maintained in recent
period, thus gates are mostly broken due to job failures. Besides,
by removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/stein is deleted. Propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: I5deb2c0958fd0d49d32de93503a886af8ba3e429

commit_message:
[requirements] Transition Stein to End of Life

As announced on mailing list [1], this patch transitions the Stein
branch to End of Life. The last patch of the branch will be tagged with
stein-eol tag. stable/stein branch cannot be used anymore and will be
deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/stein is not actively maintained in recent
period, thus gates are mostly broken due to job failures. Besides,
by removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/stein is deleted. Propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-September/034965.html

Change-Id: I1ac3e000f74a97d1b0758569a92e3f2d7e396427

commit_message:
bandit: Disable B411

Bandit 1.7.6 now always raises B411 error when xmlrpc is imported.
The error can't be resolved even if we make the suggested change in
code. Let's disable the check for now to unblock gate.

Change-Id: I515af75af2b790eaee52692abebae2fa8387aed1

commit_message:
Add opentelemetry publisher base on http

Opentelemetry is a standard data protocol of observability.
This patch add a new publisher about 'opentelemetry', it use
http to send data in json format to opentelemetry collector.
In the future, we can try to send data to opentelemetry by gRPC.

Change-Id: Ifa20d29d27e35d98999bf0e7ae519ebcedf811aa

commit_message:
Ensure consistent ordering of network_mappings

The provider_networks module returned the network_mappings in a random
order changing with every invocation. This returns the entries sorted
and adds a test to ensure the ordering is consistent between
invocations.

Change-Id: Iaec4534ebd8ff80cf7c7e3a1c8f187dd3990e4bc

of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I65d3fa2e3d6d38f0a51ce1f402ac25d976b67b89

commit_message:
[WIP] remmove eventlet form nova api wsgi

This change adds an anyio version of the scatter_gather_cells
function removing the dependency on eventlet from the api
when run under a wsgi server.

the eventlet implementation is keep to support the nova-api
console_script for now.

anyio is a wrapper around the stdlib asyncio functionality
providing the structural async api of trio while maintaining
asyncio compatiblity.

This enables use to benift from task groups without the py3.11
requirement and cancelation scopes to provide timeouts.

Change-Id: I158566da32bc83489b009dd8da66f14fc654a301

commit_message:
Fixed sqlalchemy 2.x support

Re-arranged sessions to always be at the top level to make
it easier to know the origin of the current session. This
is important now that we no longer have autocommit enabled.

- Added zuul job testing sqlalchemy 2.x.
- Added new db api for service cleanup.
- Removed broken sqlite cleanup step during testing.

Change-Id: I168f3d9518611ac66cb9eec1132a7add19e92d5f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-29 11:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'message': 'Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d

commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I0f1bd3aa3dbce93c42fdb9399948c41edab2369d

subject: Fix defenition of multiple static routes for network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 17:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'templates/systemd-network-routes.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/networkd_multiple_routes-becb9e691f38987a.yaml', 'templates/systemd-network.j2'], 'message': 'Fix defenition of multiple static routes for network

Current logic was relying on iteration inside the template. However,
since config_template module was used to deliver network configuration
it was merging sections having same name together.

While this behaviour is correct one for config_template as all sections
must be unique from ConfigParser perspective and in order to apply
overrides properly, it was not suiting the way how routes should be
defined in networkd configuration.

To workaround the issue we place routes separately under <network>.d
directory, which should be supported by systemd [1]

[1] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/latest/systemd.network.html

Closes-Bug: #2045819
Change-Id: I01aa44dcdc85e32d18dd52bcd4878a9017fb6ead
(cherry picked from commit 70442c5efb34222d0e333422fc469608795c70e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix defenition of multiple static routes for network

Current logic was relying on iteration inside the template. However,
since config_template module was used to deliver network configuration
it was merging sections having same name together.

While this behaviour is correct one for config_template as all sections
must be unique from ConfigParser perspective and in order to apply
overrides properly, it was not suiting the way how routes should be
defined in networkd configuration.

To workaround the issue we place routes separately under <network>.d
directory, which should be supported by systemd [1]

[1] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/latest/systemd.network.html

Closes-Bug: #2045819
Change-Id: I01aa44dcdc85e32d18dd52bcd4878a9017fb6ead
(cherry picked from commit 70442c5efb34222d0e333422fc469608795c70e4)

subject: Ensure filename is always defined for network/netdev
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 17:55:01.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/networkd_filename_formatting-ce5e032876cdca09.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure filename is always defined for network/netdev

commit_message:
Ensure filename is always defined for network/netdev

Right now we define resulting filename in the loop itself, which limits
ability to predict expected filename for another loop where list might
get filtered.

So to get more expected behaviour between tasks we always add filename
to the elements in vars.

Change-Id: I579980ea3a5e9349d25885530c979649cb6dcb81
(cherry picked from commit 18b36137dcfa740ea9238bd2cbaaf0762667dbec)

subject: Remove `localhost` record from hosts file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-29 09:48:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do_not_add_localhost_to_hosts-36e365b95dc9da42.yaml', 'tasks/openstack_update_hosts_file.yml'], 'message': 'Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde
'}]
commit_message:
Remove `localhost` record from hosts file

After adding `localhost` to inventory explicitly [1] this caused an interesting
side-effect, where a record for `localhost` is being added to the managed block
in /etc/hosts file, which might override FQDN defenition for the host.

This also makes healthcheck-hosts.yml fail the test, since expected record is not present.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/899523

Change-Id: If1840530a54aa9ae22eda1d3094f0c40ab66ddde

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 14:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/networkd_filename_formatting-ce5e032876cdca09.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure filename is always defined for network/netdev

So to get more expected behaviour between tasks we always add filename

Change-Id: I579980ea3a5e9349d25885530c979649cb6dcb81

commit_message:
Ensure filename is always defined for network/netdev

Right now we define resulting filename in the loop itself, which limits
ability to predict expected filename for another loop where list might
get filtered.

So to get more expected behaviour between tasks we always add filename
to the elements in vars.

Change-Id: I579980ea3a5e9349d25885530c979649cb6dcb81
(cherry picked from commit 18b36137dcfa740ea9238bd2cbaaf0762667dbec)

Recordset: Remove deprecated --records argument

The --records argument was deprecated in 2.8.0[1], which was released
during queens cycle. Multiple cycles have passed since then so we can
remove these deprecated options now.

commit_message:
Disable venv_wheel_build_enable for CI

Building wheels take more time for the single host deployment. So
we consume more CI time then needed. At the same time all real
deployments will be building wheels.

Change-Id: Ie64543ebbdf15afd0a4e938824415224776883c4

commit_message:
Use real SDK objects in tests

This seems a little more realistic. The only notable change here is that
we use a default 'provision_state' of 'available' for fake Node objects,
since that's what SDK will default to [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/1.3.1/openstack/baremetal/v1/node.py#L256-L261

Change-Id: Icf7545736eec57efe5a810a593ad5438661ae0bb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add httpchk option when httpcheck_options are defined

In order for http-check to work, option httpchk must be loaded first. Otherwise
regular L4 check will be issued and all `http-check` will be simply ignored.

Closes-Bug: #2046223
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/903545
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/904303
Change-Id: Ie9ed322ab9c4a04d42cab4456567ac5d1f5c966b
(cherry picked from commit 16ab20815f449703a94923a8613bf3577bef2833)

subject: Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 14:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit

Default value of Restart for any service which type is not `oneshot` is
`on-failure`. While this suits most usecases, this leads to unexpected
consequences for cinder-purge-deleted.service.

In case there're some historical inconsistencies in the database which
make impossible to flush deleted volumes from the database
(ie due to prior manual intervention), cinder-manage exists with code 1
which triggers systemd to restart the service and attempt cleanup again.

The troublesome part is the transactional behaviour of the script. With
each run it locks records in it's transaction that is failing and being
reverted in a loops with 2 sec delay, that not only causes unnecessary
load for database itself, but also causes deadlocks during operations
with volumes that are not being re-tryed and fail with 500 return code
in cinder-api.

Changing Restart to `on-abnormal` will leave service in a failed state
and systemd won't attempt to restart it.

Change-Id: Ib091cc11a16fcd31ef351d9ec21d070d25829791
(cherry picked from commit 7e2cf5283f9cfb3a8a02263a3c0b0bd4d0518a58)
"}]
commit_message:
Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit

Default value of Restart for any service which type is not `oneshot` is
`on-failure`. While this suits most usecases, this leads to unexpected
consequences for cinder-purge-deleted.service.

In case there're some historical inconsistencies in the database which
make impossible to flush deleted volumes from the database
(ie due to prior manual intervention), cinder-manage exists with code 1
which triggers systemd to restart the service and attempt cleanup again.

The troublesome part is the transactional behaviour of the script. With
each run it locks records in it's transaction that is failing and being
reverted in a loops with 2 sec delay, that not only causes unnecessary
load for database itself, but also causes deadlocks during operations
with volumes that are not being re-tryed and fail with 500 return code
in cinder-api.

Changing Restart to `on-abnormal` will leave service in a failed state
and systemd won't attempt to restart it.

Change-Id: Ib091cc11a16fcd31ef351d9ec21d070d25829791
(cherry picked from commit 7e2cf5283f9cfb3a8a02263a3c0b0bd4d0518a58)

subject: Set the default domain for the role_assignment
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-11-13 11:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['roles/service_setup/tasks/setup_roles.yml'], 'message': 'Set the default domain for the role_assignment

From time to time it might happen in deployments, that some project
will create a service user in their domains. When this happens and
domain is not supplied for the role_assignment module fails with
multiple users with the same name exist.

However, domain param is used not only for lookups but also for
scoped assignments [1]. When project is not supplied, domain scope
will be assigned. And when domain is not defined, then system scope
will be applied. But since all projects (except keystone) have reverted
their system_scope efforts, we can safely set default for the domain
to workaround potential issues with lookups.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/openstack/cloud/role_assignment_module.html#parameter-domain

Change-Id: Ia406d101632806d18495380d8911468ea14bc502
'}]
commit_message:
Set the default domain for the role_assignment

From time to time it might happen in deployments, that some project
will create a service user in their domains. When this happens and
domain is not supplied for the role_assignment module fails with
multiple users with the same name exist.

However, domain param is used not only for lookups but also for
scoped assignments [1]. When project is not supplied, domain scope
will be assigned. And when domain is not defined, then system scope
will be applied. But since all projects (except keystone) have reverted
their system_scope efforts, we can safely set default for the domain
to workaround potential issues with lookups.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/openstack/cloud/role_assignment_module.html#parameter-domain

Change-Id: Ia406d101632806d18495380d8911468ea14bc502

commit_message:

The cafile parameter in the authentication section is required
in the senlin.conf configuration file when working with
self-signed certificates.

subject: bump rabbitmq-server role to resolve installation issue on Rocky
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-12-22 23:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'bump rabbitmq-server role to resolve installation issue on Rocky

Need to bump rabbitmq-server on 2023.1 to include 904100[1] which
addresses installation on 2023.1 for Rocky due to a erlang release which
was removed from novemberain repositories. This is also needed to clear
gates which involve upgrade paths.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/904100

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/903544
Change-Id: Ia12aaeefe3bec6868448ae07c124aa4324d7cbb3
'}]
commit_message:
bump rabbitmq-server role to resolve installation issue on Rocky

Need to bump rabbitmq-server on 2023.1 to include 904100[1] which
addresses installation on 2023.1 for Rocky due to a erlang release which
was removed from novemberain repositories. This is also needed to clear
gates which involve upgrade paths.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/+/904100

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/903544
Change-Id: Ia12aaeefe3bec6868448ae07c124aa4324d7cbb3

commit_message:
kolla_address: check correct error return value

Unlike other methods such as resolve(), get() does not return an Undefined object, but None.
This removes 4 ansible-lint warnings in various files calling kolla_address.

Closes-Bug: #2038281

Change-Id: I591a50512a954210f951c40a350ed4b9e1fc48ae
(cherry picked from commit eec8b05914878f52858f37bbf675994e4e80d74b)

commit_message:
kolla_address: check correct error return value

Unlike other methods such as resolve(), get() does not return an Undefined object, but None.
This removes 4 ansible-lint warnings in various files calling kolla_address.

Closes-Bug: #2038281

Change-Id: I591a50512a954210f951c40a350ed4b9e1fc48ae

revisions:

Since switching to use HAProxy to access Prometheus OpenStack exporter,
scraping would fail when using internal TLS with an FQDN (rather than an
IP address) to access the API.

This patch fixes the issue by using the FQDN instead of the VIP address.

Change-Id: Iddbdc4190b7953e9140d0740daf57f4062ba1b76

(cherry picked from commit c2838823f1120cb571c1557b9c159d845d85f1a2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OpenStack exporter scrape with internal TLS & FQDN

Since switching to use HAProxy to access Prometheus OpenStack exporter,
scraping would fail when using internal TLS with an FQDN (rather than an
IP address) to access the API.

This patch fixes the issue by using the FQDN instead of the VIP address.

Change-Id: Iddbdc4190b7953e9140d0740daf57f4062ba1b76
Closes-Bug: #2008208
(cherry picked from commit c2838823f1120cb571c1557b9c159d845d85f1a2)

commit_message:
Adds condition to handle QoS extension in sriov_agent.ini template

When Neutron QoS is enabled, the QoS extension needs to be defined
in the sriov_agent.ini file.

commit_message:
senlin: add missing cafile parameter

The cafile parameter in the authentication section is required
in the senlin.conf configuration file when working with
self-signed certificates.

commit_message:
Uses shell=False in postgresql backup driver

This PR changes the subprocess arg from 'shell=True' to 'shell=False'
to enhance security in postgresql backup driver.

The original problem is remote code execution bug in backup driver.

Story: 2010004
Task: 47288
Change-Id: I393b1822ad410e9499964880e7e008b85ead78eb

subject: Adding CACERT and NO_VERIFY option on senlinclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-28 06:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['senlin_dashboard/api/senlin.py'], 'message': 'Adding CACERT and NO_VERIFY option on senlinclient

When deploy openstack with selfsigned CA cert, the senlin-dashboard unable to fetch required data.
Adding `cacert = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT` and `insecure = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY` to build ks_session.Session suitable for current environment

Closes-Bug: #2047622
Change-Id: I01e774a99ab26afe4fa78181be6ce1a33aac73a2
'}]
commit_message:
Adding CACERT and NO_VERIFY option on senlinclient

When deploy openstack with selfsigned CA cert, the senlin-dashboard unable to fetch required data.
Adding `cacert = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT` and `insecure = settings.OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY` to build ks_session.Session suitable for current environment

Closes-Bug: #2047622
Change-Id: I01e774a99ab26afe4fa78181be6ce1a33aac73a2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-27 13:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': "[CI] setting backup&replication voting to false

There are many cases where these jobs fail due to swift errors.
We don't want to always recheck these jobs.

This commit set backup and replication jobs' voting to false.

Change-Id: I202af622df280df435bb237396627a715dd5d299
"}]
commit_message:
[CI] setting backup&replication voting to false

There are many cases where these jobs fail due to swift errors.
We don't want to always recheck these jobs.

This commit set backup and replication jobs' voting to false.

Change-Id: I202af622df280df435bb237396627a715dd5d299

subject: Add precheck for RabbitMQ quorum queues
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-12-14 15:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq-add-precheck-for-quorum-queues-ba10f58538959112.yaml', 'ansible/roles/rabbitmq/tasks/precheck.yml', 'tests/upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Add precheck for RabbitMQ quorum queues

Adds a precheck to fail if non-quorum queues are found in RabbitMQ.

Currently excludes fanout and reply queues, pending support in
oslo.messaging [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.messaging/+/888479

Closes-Bug: #2045887
Change-Id: Ibafdcd58618d97251a3405ef9332022d4d930e2b
(cherry picked from commit 61f84e3beb730468ba715753d2e51475d6b0b7d3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add precheck for RabbitMQ quorum queues

Adds a precheck to fail if non-quorum queues are found in RabbitMQ.

Currently excludes fanout and reply queues, pending support in
oslo.messaging [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.messaging/+/888479

Closes-Bug: #2045887
Change-Id: Ibafdcd58618d97251a3405ef9332022d4d930e2b
(cherry picked from commit 61f84e3beb730468ba715753d2e51475d6b0b7d3)

commit_message:
Set a log retention policy for OpenSearch

We previously used ElasticSearch Curator for managing log
retention. Now that we have moved to OpenSearch, we can use
the Index State Management (ISM) plugin which is bundled with
OpenSearch.

This change adds support for automating the configuration of
the ISM plugin via the OpenSearch API. By default, it has
similar behaviour to the previous ElasticSearch Curator
default policy.

Closes-Bug: #2047037

Change-Id: I5c6d938f2bc380f1575ee4f16fe17c6dca37dcba
(cherry picked from commit 5e5a2dca0900e5c167e1ab55ef6dc14198ce2903)

commit_message:
Adding mariadb_port to wsrep sync status so alterative ports can be used

Also added '-h {{ api_interface_address }}' because on Yoga version client
tries to connect to the 'localhost' instead of bound address.

Closes-Bug: #2024554
Change-Id: Id6eae798784126d4dd53adef15bdce6b47b4601f
(cherry picked from commit 842e758221a63e4bc5adf31bec061ea7aa22b3cb)

Set a log retention policy for OpenSearch

We previously used ElasticSearch Curator for managing log
retention. Now that we have moved to OpenSearch, we can use

commit_message:
Sync only local cell in nova bootstrap & upgrade

Added the --local_cell argument to nova db sync commands during
bootstrap and upgrade.

This was previously thought to have no effect [1], but has since been
discovered to fail when rotating the nova database password.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/src/branch/master/ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml#L2-L3

Closes-Bug: #2045558
Change-Id: Ic64eb51325b3503a14ebab9b9ff2f4d9caec734a
(cherry picked from commit de1487f05187387aea3f113dcbb6926734b1ce6b)

subject: Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 8313, 'name': 'Lajos Katona', 'display_name': 'lajoskatona', 'email': 'katonalala@gmail.com', 'username': 'elajkat', 'status': 'Eicsson Software Technologies'}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-12-15 11:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_securitygroup.py', 'neutron/objects/securitygroup.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``

This method populates the SG rules in a dictionary. Each SG rule
inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each
SG rule was isuing a database call to retrieve the SG register.

In this patch, the SG "stateful" retrieval is done in one database
query for all SG. That improves the performance of this method
reducing the database access to only one single call.

This improvement, as commented in the LP bug, affects to
ML2/LinuxBridge. ML2/OVS agent uses a cached RPC implementation
that not requires to perform any RPC call/database query.

Closes-Bug: #2045950
Change-Id: Iafd0419a1d1eeb25d5589edc2570ebf287450957
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the SG RPC callback ``security_group_info_for_ports``

This method populates the SG rules in a dictionary. Each SG rule
inherits the "stateful" value of the SG. Prior to this patch, each
SG rule was isuing a database call to retrieve the SG register.

In this patch, the SG "stateful" retrieval is done in one database
query for all SG. That improves the performance of this method
reducing the database access to only one single call.

This improvement, as commented in the LP bug, affects to
ML2/LinuxBridge. ML2/OVS agent uses a cached RPC implementation
that not requires to perform any RPC call/database query.

Closes-Bug: #2045950
Change-Id: Iafd0419a1d1eeb25d5589edc2570ebf287450957

  error: Never not callable  [misc]

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
mypy: Remove errant annotation

The type can inferred and what we have specified is too broad, resulting
in the following error on recent mypy versions:

  error: Never not callable  [misc]

Change-Id: Ia24938bb0db79f091854467df82dcd0981765db9

subject: Use el/9 repo urls instead of el/8 since a repo is available for it
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2023-12-21 19:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat.yml'], 'message': 'Use el/9 repo urls instead of el/8 since a repo is available for it

As we target el9 and not el8, we should use the el/9 repo as it is
available, even though it provides RPMs with an `el8` dist tag. This can
help prevent confusion for users who see a repo on the system configured
with `el/8` in the repourl.

There should be no impact on existing installations, as the same repo
content is provided in both repos in almost all cases--namely, a few
early versions of erlang are unavailable, but as we pin to a version
that exists in both repos, there is no impact to this change: at worst,
the erlang package will be upgraded to a newer minor version if a user
somehow has an older one installed.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/903544
Change-Id: I70c13f7f882ce8666b12314a31f76fe63599677c
(cherry picked from commit efd5ba9be762ceec7e08fdebfc7522b21556ae62)
'}]
commit_message:
Use el/9 repo urls instead of el/8 since a repo is available for it

As we target el9 and not el8, we should use the el/9 repo as it is
available, even though it provides RPMs with an `el8` dist tag. This can
help prevent confusion for users who see a repo on the system configured
with `el/8` in the repourl.

There should be no impact on existing installations, as the same repo
content is provided in both repos in almost all cases--namely, a few
early versions of erlang are unavailable, but as we pin to a version
that exists in both repos, there is no impact to this change: at worst,
the erlang package will be upgraded to a newer minor version if a user
somehow has an older one installed.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/903544
Change-Id: I70c13f7f882ce8666b12314a31f76fe63599677c
(cherry picked from commit efd5ba9be762ceec7e08fdebfc7522b21556ae62)

subject: Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-12-15 14:05:33.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit

Default value of Restart for any service which type is not `oneshot` is
`on-failure`. While this suits most usecases, this leads to unexpected
consequences for cinder-purge-deleted.service.

In case there're some historical inconsistencies in the database which
make impossible to flush deleted volumes from the database
(ie due to prior manual intervention), cinder-manage exists with code 1
which triggers systemd to restart the service and attempt cleanup again.

The troublesome part is the transactional behaviour of the script. With
each run it locks records in it's transaction that is failing and being
reverted in a loops with 2 sec delay, that not only causes unnecessary
load for database itself, but also causes deadlocks during operations
with volumes that are not being re-tryed and fail with 500 return code
in cinder-api.

Changing Restart to `on-abnormal` will leave service in a failed state
and systemd won't attempt to restart it.

Change-Id: Ib091cc11a16fcd31ef351d9ec21d070d25829791
(cherry picked from commit 7e2cf5283f9cfb3a8a02263a3c0b0bd4d0518a58)
"}]
commit_message:
Restart cinder-purge-deleted service only on abnormal exit

Default value of Restart for any service which type is not `oneshot` is
`on-failure`. While this suits most usecases, this leads to unexpected
consequences for cinder-purge-deleted.service.

In case there're some historical inconsistencies in the database which
make impossible to flush deleted volumes from the database
(ie due to prior manual intervention), cinder-manage exists with code 1
which triggers systemd to restart the service and attempt cleanup again.

The troublesome part is the transactional behaviour of the script. With
each run it locks records in it's transaction that is failing and being
reverted in a loops with 2 sec delay, that not only causes unnecessary
load for database itself, but also causes deadlocks during operations
with volumes that are not being re-tryed and fail with 500 return code
in cinder-api.

Changing Restart to `on-abnormal` will leave service in a failed state
and systemd won't attempt to restart it.

Change-Id: Ib091cc11a16fcd31ef351d9ec21d070d25829791
(cherry picked from commit 7e2cf5283f9cfb3a8a02263a3c0b0bd4d0518a58)

commit_message:
Allow LB members to mix IPv4 and IPv6 for the multivip LB

When creating a load balancer with both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols
for the LB VIP and additional_vips field, it is essential to
allow the mixing of IPv4 and IPv6 backend members.

This patch enables this use case and ensures that the 'vips'
field in the OVN NB DB associates IPv4-type LB VIPs with IPv4
members and IPv6-type LB VIPs with IPv6 members exclusively.

Closes-Bug: 2047055
Change-Id: I173a6456e8a5f776cac207390e670afa34f83d7c

with agent 'OVN Controller agent' should be cleaned up.

Since change: I935186b6ee95f0cae8dc05869d9742c8fb3353c3 there
is de-duplication of segmenthostmapping updates from agents.
If the OVN DB sync clears/deletes mappings for hosts owned by

commit_message:
[OVN] DB sync host/physnet - filter on agent_type

When syncing hostname and physical networks, filter neutron
hosts on agent_type. Only segmenthostmappings for hosts
with agent 'OVN Controller agent' should be cleaned up.

Since change: I935186b6ee95f0cae8dc05869d9742c8fb3353c3 there
is de-duplication of segmenthostmapping updates from agents.
If the OVN DB sync clears/deletes mappings for hosts owned by
other agents/plugins the mappings are never re-created.

Closes-Bug: #2040172

Change-Id: Iaf15e560e1b1ec31618b2ebc6206a938463c1094
Signed-off-by: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3aafeefc8553fd637bad238ee236b1767d8548ea)

commit_message:
[OVN] DB sync host/physnet - filter on agent_type

When syncing hostname and physical networks, filter neutron
hosts on agent_type. Only segmenthostmappings for hosts
with agent 'OVN Controller agent' should be cleaned up.

Since change: I935186b6ee95f0cae8dc05869d9742c8fb3353c3 there
is de-duplication of segmenthostmapping updates from agents.
If the OVN DB sync clears/deletes mappings for hosts owned by
other agents/plugins the mappings are never re-created.

Closes-Bug: #2040172

Change-Id: Iaf15e560e1b1ec31618b2ebc6206a938463c1094
Signed-off-by: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71d69cf6277ba553354512209a2bff61c013f8ea)

commit_message:
[OVN] Retrieve the OVN agent extensions correctly

Now the OVN agent implements a method ``__getitem__`` that retrieves,
from ``self.ext_manager``, a loaded extension by its name. The method
returns the instantiated extension object.

Closes-Bug: #2046892

commit_message:
[kolla] Transition Ussuri to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: Idf1cc77273ad78eaad090dcaf627e69051a14e8d

commit_message:
Set a log retention policy for OpenSearch

We previously used ElasticSearch Curator for managing log
retention. Now that we have moved to OpenSearch, we can use
the Index State Management (ISM) plugin which is bundled with
OpenSearch.

This change adds support for automating the configuration of
the ISM plugin via the OpenSearch API. By default, it has
similar behaviour to the previous ElasticSearch Curator
default policy.

Closes-Bug: #2047037

Change-Id: I5c6d938f2bc380f1575ee4f16fe17c6dca37dcba

subject: Fix: Add timeout for mysql driver
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-07-10 14:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/mysql.py', 'tooz/tests/test_mysql.py'], 'message': "Fix: Add timeout for mysql driver

The issue with current one is we try to use blocking as timeout
provider.
That make the timeout setting in mysql bound with blocking.
And the lock can't served with scenario that when we don't need timeout
blocking but still timeout required.

Change-Id: I36c80f882a91cd1c63d5a3bc2d1d8cb50f6637c6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: Add timeout for mysql driver

The issue with current one is we try to use blocking as timeout
provider.
That make the timeout setting in mysql bound with blocking.
And the lock can't served with scenario that when we don't need timeout
blocking but still timeout required.

Change-Id: I36c80f882a91cd1c63d5a3bc2d1d8cb50f6637c6
